gil.io.example
Class ExamplePMAdapter

java.lang.Object
  gil.io.example.ExamplePMAdapter
All Implemented Interfaces:
IControlCommandInvokeable, IProcessModelAdapter
public class ExamplePMAdapter
extends java.lang.Object
implements IProcessModelAdapter

This class exemplifies the implementation of the IProcessModelAdapter interface. It works in pair with the ExampleESAdapter. Please see IProcessModelAdapter.java for implementation details

Method Detail

setup

public void setup(SignalMetadata[] signalsToPM,
                  SignalMetadata[] signalsFromPM,
                  Parameters config)
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Does the initial setup of the adapter.

Sets up a sequence of signals to be read and written using the readSignalData() and writeSignalData() respectively.

Specified by:
setup in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Parameters:
signalsToPM - An array of signal metadata specifying the signal values to be transferred from the external system to the process model.
signalsFromPM - An array of signal metadata specifying the signal values to be transferred from the process model to the external system.
config - A collection of key-, value pairs holding configuration parameters specific to each implementation of IProcessModelAdapter. Key-, value pairs are wrapped in a Parameters class for convenience.

connect

public boolean connect()
                throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Connects to the process model.

This operation may block for a longer period of time since several connect attempts may be done by the current implementation of the PM-adapter. An IOException is thrown if there is a serious problem preventing a connection to be established.

Specified by:
connect in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Returns:
Returns true if connected otherwise false. Please note that false is not indicating a failure. The caller will call this method repeatedly until true is returned or an exception thrown.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Is thrown to force the caller to an error state that must be handled by manual intervention.

disconnect

public void disconnect()
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Disconnects from the process model.

The call is just ignored if already disconnected.

Specified by:
disconnect in interface IProcessModelAdapter

readSignalData

public Result readSignalData(java.nio.ByteBuffer destBuf)
                      throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Reads process data.

Reads values, of the previously setup sequence of signals, from the process model.

Specified by:
readSignalData in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Parameters:
destBuf - If data is available this buffer will be populated with signal values. The number of signal values and their data type must correspond to the sequence of signal metadata given in a previous call to setup(). The given ByteBuffer has memory allocated just enough to contain the expected signal values.

When this operation is called, the given ByteBuffer has a preset byte order (endianness). The caller expects data to be added in that byte order. This has to be taken into consideration only if the byte array that backs the ByteBuffer is accessed directly. Using put methods, i.e. putFloat, putInt, putShort etc. is safe.

Returns:
Null or a result object indicating success or failure. When there is no data available null is returned. A failure will indicate to the caller that this read was unsuccessful but subsequent reads may succeed. An IOException shall be thrown for unrecoverable serious failures.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is a serious failure to force the caller to disconnect from the process model and reconnect.

writeSignalData

public Result writeSignalData(java.nio.ByteBuffer values)
                       throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Writes process data.

Writes values, of the previously setup sequence of signals, to the process model.

Specified by:
writeSignalData in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Parameters:
values - A buffer containing the sequence of signal values to be written to the process model. The number of signal values and their data type must correspond to the sequence of signal metadata given in a previous call to setup().
Returns:
A result object indicating success or failure. A failure will indicate to the caller that this write was unsuccessful but subsequent writes may succeed. The caller will not retry to rewrite the same signal values. However, the caller will continue to call this method for new data. An IOException is thrown for unrecoverable serious failures.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is a serious failure to force the caller to disconnect from the process model and reconnect.

getSimTime

public ValueResult<SimTime> getSimTime()
                                throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Returns the current date and time of the process model simulation clock. The returned time will be used by the caller to detect frame changes in the process model and transfer the simulation time to the external system.

Specified by:
getSimTime in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Returns:
A result object indicating success or failure. When success, the result object contains the simulator time.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is a serious failure to force the caller to disconnect from the process model and reconnect.

getOperatingFrequency

public int getOperatingFrequency()
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Returns the process model operating frequency in Hertz.

Specified by:
getOperatingFrequency in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Returns:
the process model operating frequency in Hertz.

readSimCommands

public ValueResult<Command[]> readSimCommands()
                                       throws java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Returns simulator commands that have occurred since the last call to this operation.

The returned ValueResult object indicates failure if the read is unsuccessful. Failure indicated by the ValueResult object will tell the caller that this call was unsuccessful but subsequent calls may succeed. When the failure is major, an IOException is thrown which shall cause the caller to call disconnect followed by a reconnect.

Specified by:
readSimCommands in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Returns:
a ValueResult object containing an array of commands with the command that have occurred since the last call to this operation.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - Thrown when there is a serious failure to force the caller to disconnect from the process model and reconnect.

getInfo

public SoftwareInfo[] getInfo()
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Returns software info such as version info.

Returns information about this implementation of the IProcessModelAdapter interface, the process model and possibly about connected subsystems.

Specified by:
getInfo in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Returns:
Returns the software info structure for the current implementation of this interface and connected subsystems. Index 0 contains the software info structure for the implementation of this interface. If available; subsequent indexes contains information about the process model and subsystems thereof.

getStatus

public SystemStatus getStatus()
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Returns the system status of the process model.

This gives an indication if the process model is OK or not OK. It may not be possible to detect the current status of the process model and in that case SystemStatus.NOT_AVAILABLE shall be returned.

Specified by:
getStatus in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Returns:
The current status of the process model.

getState

public int getState()
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Returns the current operating state. e.g. run, freeze.

States only has a meaning if the current status returned from getStatus() is OK. Common states are defined in SimState.

Specified by:
getState in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Returns:
The current state e.g. running, freeze.

addProgressChangeListener

public boolean addProgressChangeListener(IProgressEventListener listener)
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Adds a listener to receive progress change notifications.

Specified by:
addProgressChangeListener in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Parameters:
listener - The listener that subscibes for notifications when progress changes. The listeners must handle concurrency since they may be called from separate threads.
Returns:
true if the implemantation supports progress change notifications and the caller can expect to receive notifications. Returns false when progress change notifications are not supported.

availableControlCommands

public CommandDescriptor[] availableControlCommands()
Description copied from interface: IProcessModelAdapter
Returns a list of control commands that can be invoked from client software.

The implementation of the IProcessModelAdapter interface may support a set of control commands that can be invoked to control the behavior of the adapter. This method lists the available commands. Commands listed may be invoked by calling invokeControlCommand.

Specified by:
availableControlCommands in interface IProcessModelAdapter
Returns:
An array holding the specification for each available command. If no commands are available, an array containing zero elements is returned.

invokeControlCommand

public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> invokeControlCommand(Command command)
                                                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                                                             java.io.IOException
Description copied from interface: IControlCommandInvokeable
Invokes a control command.

Used to invoke commands to control the behavior of the implementation. The commands are specific to each implementation of this interface.

Specified by:
invokeControlCommand in interface IControlCommandInvokeable
Parameters:
command - The command to invoke.
Returns:
A map of result parameters.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the given command or any parameter is illegal.
java.io.IOException - If the execution of the command failed.
